meanings.definition: The act of taking hold or control of something.
meanings.sent1: The cat's quick seizings of the toy showed its playful nature.
meanings.sent2: His strong seizings of the steering wheel kept the car steady on the road.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's seizings of the remote control made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her seizings of the microphone captured the attention of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler's powerful seizings of his opponent demonstrated his strength.

meanings.definition: Materials used for binding or fastening ropes together.
meanings.sent1: The sailor used sturdy seizings to secure the ropes to the mast.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman carefully selected the right seizings for the job.
meanings.sent3: The comical clown juggled colorful seizings instead of balls.
meanings.sent4: The friendship was like strong seizings, keeping them connected through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map depicted intricate seizings used by sailors to navigate the seas.
